data.text: @yaneerbaryam @HaplogroupNews @cdanuloff Or…increase? It’s all just spike protein. And we know now it gets in the bloodstream despite what we were promised.
@yaneerbaryam Disgraceful that governments in Australia have dropped indoor mask mandates

@yaneerbaryam @cdanuloff I wonder how many times, on average, a fully vaxxed and boosted C++ developer can get COVID-19 before it impacts their ability to write reliable code? This is a highly unethical experiment, but we seem to be doing it anyhow.
@yaneerbaryam @HaplogroupNews Have no idea but important to report that was not studied.
@HaplogroupNews @cdanuloff I wonder if, being an entrepreneur CEO, he is OK to gamble on the possibility that vaccination might with low probability reduce the level of brain damage.

@cdanuloff @yaneerbaryam It would be surprising if the vaccine prevented this issue in those who become infected, as there is not a mechanism for it to do so. The study shows the problem in even "mild" cases. Omicron has caused many thousands of "mild" cases in the vaccinated.
@yaneerbaryam Does that explain the antivaxxers then? Phew
@yaneerbaryam Only shown in non-vaccinated cases (important clarification). Study done before vaccines existed.
